title: Mantra
summary: A mantra (Sanskrit: मन्त्र, romanized: mantra, /ˈmʌntrə/; Pali: mantaṃ) or mantram[2] is a sacred utterance, a numinous sound, a syllable, word or phonemes, or group of words in Sanskrit, Pali and other languages believed by practitioners to have religious, magical or spiritual powers.[3][4] Some mantras have a syntactic structure and literal meaning, while others do not.[3][5]
